sentences.sContent: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.sCn: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.sContent: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.sCn: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.sContent: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.sCn: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.sContent: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.sCn: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.sContent: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.sCn: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.sContent: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.sCn: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.sContent: A murmur of approval passed through the crowd.

phrases.pCn: 审批流程；审批手续；批准流程
事先批准；预先审批；事前批准；事前许可；预先核准
立项；项目批准；项目许可

remMethod.val: ap+prov(看作prove， 证实)+al(表行为)→实物为证， 不可否认→认可

words.tran: 批准；认可（approve的现在分词形式）；赞成

trans.tranOther: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted
